oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Antimicrobial resistance of strains of Pasteurella hemolytica isolated from feedlot cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Amstutz, H. E.
Morter, R. L.
Armstrong, C. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: aminoglycoside antibiotics
Ampicillin
Antibiotics
bacterial diseases
beta-lactam antibiotics
Chloramphenicol
drug resistance
Drug therapy
Neomycin
penicillins
respiratory diseases
Streptomycin
Sulfonamides
Tetracyclines
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: P. haemolytica was isolated from 51 of 65 nasal swabs taken from cattle with untreated respiratory disease in Kentucky in 1978 (23 of 29 cattle), 1979 (18 of 22), and 1980 (10 of 14). Isolates were resistant (in vitro) to ampicillin (21 isolates), streptomycin (46), tetracycline (46), triple-sulfonamide (12), chloramphenicol (1), nitrofuran (1), and neomycin (1). All isolates were resistant to at least 2 drugs, 8 were resistant to 4, and one to all 7.
